text:
The festival of festivals held on the
surface of the moon, the Galaxy Carnival Expo.
An attack occurred in the midst of it.

Thanks to [Player] and the heroes' efforts,
the incident was resolved,
and several days have passed since then.

The event has regained its composure,
and is about to reach its grand
finale with great success.

Walking through the stalls of the bustling Japan Pavilion,
which has succeeded in attracting customers,
[Player] mutters to themselves.

options.text: I can't believe it's gotten this lively...
It has gotten so different from the first day.
I'm glad we've all worked hard.

text:
While enjoying the laughter from the people around
and the aroma wafting from the food stalls,
[Player] hears a voice calling out to them.

name: Turbak
text:
[Player]-kun!
Good work out there, have you been
enjoying the festival to the end?

options.text: Yes, I'm having a great time!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Turbak
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Ah, this?
I wanted to let my hair down a bit for the last day.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Turbak
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I thought I'd enjoy it in my plain clothes for a change.
If it looks good on me, I'm glad.

options.text: That outfit looks great on you!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Turbak
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Ah, this?
I wanted to let my hair down a bit for the last day.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Turbak
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I thought I'd enjoy it in my plain clothes for a change.
If it looks good on me, I'm glad.

name: Turbak
text:
[Player]-kun, are you also going to look
around the festival one last time?
If you'd like, how about we go together?

options.text: I haven't had a chance to look around properly.
I wanted to talk with you, Turbak-san.

name: Turbak
text:
Thank you, [Player]-kun!
I've also studied up on Japan since
then, so let me be your guide!

As he says that, Turbak
beams and gently takes
[Player]'s hand.

name: Turbak
text:
...Um.
I don't have my tour flag right now,
so, just so we don't get separated.

Holding [Player]'s hand,
Turbak leads the way through
the bustling festival stalls.

On the path the two walk, lined on both
sides with numerous stalls, a mouth-watering
aroma was hanging in the air.

options.text: Let's grab something to bite first.

name: Turbak
text:
I've seen it many times over this
week, but with so many options,
I still can't make up my mind.

name: Turbak
text:
...Right!
Since it's the last day, let's buy each
other as much of whatever we want!

name: Turbak
text:
And then, how about we tell each other what we like?
Because, I want to know more and more about you!

Lured by the smells and the
energetic calls, the two of them go around
the stalls, buying one after another.

By the time they settled down at
a table along the path, both their
hands were full of festival food.

options.text: Ahaha... I think we bought too much.
Time to eat with all our might!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Turbak
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Don't worry, it'll be alright!
I move around a lot for my job, so I eat a lot!

name: Turbak
text:
Wow, it's a feast filling the table!
And it's all just the things
you and I like, right?

name: Turbak
text:
...I've always wanted to do this.
To just selfishly line up
only the things I like.

As he says with a laugh,
Turbak digs into the food
one after another.

name: Turbak
text:
Right, right, we were going
to tell each other what we like.
I'll be going first!

name: Turbak
text:
I ate a lot of different things at
this pavilion, but my favorite was...
This candied apple!

Turbak happily gazes at the
candy coating the red fruit,
reflecting the light.

name: Turbak
text:
In my hometown, there was a
fruit that looked just like this.
It grew in the wild, though.

name: Turbak
text:
...When I was a kid, I spent all
my time training to be a ritualist.
In between that training—

name: Turbak
text:
Finding fruit in the nearby
forest and secretly eating it
was my secret pleasure.

name: Turbak
text:
Ahaha, at first, I often
picked the wrong ones.
Some were super sour!

Turbak laughs as he reminisces about the past.
Then, his face darkens, and he
continues to speak in bits and pieces.

name: Turbak
text:
...Ever since that incident,
I find myself thinking about it a lot.
That I should have been more selfish.

name: Turbak
text:
No matter what I have said, my hometown would have
developed, and the festival would have disappeared.
But still, no matter how pointless—

name: Turbak
text:
I wanted to say that I hated it,
that I was frustrated and sad.
That's what I really wanted to say.

name: Turbak
text:
I couldn't even say what I wanted
to say most, so how will I even express
my feelings to other people now...?

options.text: And to decide to move forward...

name: Turbak
text:
...[Player]-kun.
I see, that's right.

options.text: And, you are moving forward, properly.
You're telling me what you like right now!

name: Turbak
text:
Ehh!?
No, no, not something like this!?

name: Turbak
text:
...But, thanks!
I feel a little lighter now!

name: Turbak
text:
I don't know if it'll go well,
but I have to try moving forward first.

name: Turbak
text:
I'll worry and think as much as I can!
And whatever I become as a result,
I'll accept it with a smile!

At Turbak's words,
he beams and reaches
for the food on the table.

name: Turbak
text:
Oops!
I'd better eat this before it gets cold.
Tell me your recommendation, too!

In the clamor of the passing people
and the lights of the stalls, the
two of them calmly finish their meal.

By the time they finished eating,
the monitor overhead had finished its projection,
and a starry sky spread out above them.

name: Turbak
text:
Oh, it's already this late.
Time really flies when
you're having fun.

name: Turbak
text:
After this is the Grand Finale!
To go along with it, all the
pavilions will be closing, too.

name: Turbak
text:
At the Grand Finale, there'll be
a big ceremony on the stage,
so if you'd like, we can all...

At his words, he stands up from his
seat and holds out his hand to [Player].
Turbak's expression changes.

name: Turbak
text:
...Um, you see.
I'm going to say something selfish now,
so if you don't want to, please say no.

name: Turbak
text:
...At the end, please stay by my side.
It's fine for just a moment longer, because I
want to make this happy feeling mine alone.

name: Turbak
text:
Thank you, [Player]-kun!
Well, let's get going, because
I know a special place!

With a huge smile,
Turbak once again takes [Player]'s
hand in the one he offered.

And, heading in the opposite direction
of the crowd moving to the stage,
they soon come to a stop.

It was a small clearing, sandwiched
between equipment warehouses,
with only green grass spreading out.

name: Turbak
text:
This is a reserve space.
It's for use when we suddenly
need to add stalls or equipment—

name: Turbak
text:
Like when Nessen-san and Goro-san
made that request, remember?
It was prepared for times like that.

name: Turbak
text:
But in the end, it was never used.
It's just an empty lot, but...

As he says, Turbak rolls
down onto the grass, and gently
pats the ground beside him.

name: Turbak
text:
How about it, [Player]-kun?
Ah... It might be some bad manners,
but no one will see us.

Nodding at Turbak's words,
[Player] gently
lies down on the ground.

name: Turbak
text:
...It's quiet.
It's like the bustling festival
just a moment ago was a lie.

Under the spreading starry sky,
Turbak takes the hand of [Player]
lying next to him.

name: Turbak
text:
...Thank you.
I wanted to thank you
properly once again.

name: Turbak
text:
My Parallel Weapon is all about
connecting and sharing with someone.
I understood that by feeling, but—

name: Turbak
text:
I couldn't connect with anyone
on a deep level like with their
memories or emotions.

name: Turbak
text:
I thought it was because
I wasn't a good enough person
to receive someone's feelings.

As Turbak speaks in bits and pieces,
his hand, connected to [Player]'s, trembles
for a moment, and his grip tightens.

name: Turbak
text:
But, it wasn't that.
It was just that I wasn't trying
to connect with anyone.

name: Turbak
text:
But, Roudin-san, Barrel-kun,
all the heroes.
And you... [Player]-kun.

name: Turbak
text:
You all pushed me forward, and
I connected with those attackers.
With my feelings connected to you—

name: Turbak
text:
I was truly saved.
Just having someone know my feelings,
that alone made me very happy.

options.text: It is you who saved yourself.

name: Turbak
text:
I'm going to keep connecting from now on.
To all kinds of lands, all kinds of festivals,
and then, to all kinds of people.

name: Turbak
text:
I want to tell them, that the
feelings that are as numerous as
the stars won't just disappear.

With his connected hand still in place,
Turbak turns his face to [Player]
and gives them a gentle smile.

options.text: That's a dream very much like you, Turbak-san.

name: Turbak
text:
Thank you...
I'm so glad I met you...
I'm really, really glad I could connect with you.

At the same time as his words,
the fireworks on the stage sparkled,
illuminating Turbak's expressions.

name: Turbak
text:
The festival is ending, isn't it?
...Hey, [Player]-kun.
Please, just a little longer—

name: Turbak
text:
Please let me stay like this.
I want to be connected with
you until the very end.

Pulling on their connected hand,
Turbak gently embraces [Player].

The warmth transmitted from their touching
bodies, and the heartbeat so close it could
be heard, make Turbak's face flush red.

And, illuminated by the colorful
fireworks sparkling overhead,
the two shadows quietly overlapped.
